page.title: 01Lydney
page.content: Lydney with its surrounding villages is situated between the eastern edge of the Forest of Dean and the River Severn.Gloucester is nineteen miles away and Chepstow ten. From the time of the Armada and up to Stuart times shipbuilding took place at Lydney,but the silting of the river ended this and today the river is a mile farther from the town. Coal and iron mining nearby gave the area a tinplate works and work to the small docks,now used as a marina. Early industries declined and new ones took their place after the 1939-45 war although farming and forestry are still important.Some of these industries have gone in the last three years.1985 sees efforts to bring new work for the 14% unemployed to its industrial estate,the home of a large plywood factory and other industry.
